title: Tourist Destination "Mediterranean Alps"
abstract: The objective of ALPMEDITERR is to create the touristic destination of Mediterranean Alps, through the structuration of its governance in the European Park, but also through the definition of a territorial strategy of sustainable tourism, capable to give value to the diversity and the peculiarity of this protected site, in particular regarding trekking. The project is conceived as a transition that has the goal to give operational capacities to the European Grouping of Territorial Cooperation, that unites Mercantour Park and Maritime Alps Park. The latter is already in coordination with some project partners who are participating to the project World Heritage; at the end of this project they want to continue this cooperation experience through the construction of an integrated territorial initiative for a better definition of multi-sector integrated development.

motivations: There is a need to create a structured governance for the Mediterranean Alps tourist destination within the European Park.
The Mediterranean Alps' unique diversity and peculiarity, especially for trekking, require a sustainable tourism strategy to add value to the protected site.
objectives: Establish the Mediterranean Alps as a distinct tourist destination through governance structuration and sustainable tourism strategies.
Enhance the operational capacities of the European Grouping of Territorial Cooperation to support integrated development.
methods: Define a territorial strategy for sustainable tourism that highlights the region's unique features.
Foster cooperation among project partners, including those involved in the World Heritage project, to develop an integrated territorial initiative.
results: Create a well-defined and governed tourist destination that showcases the Mediterranean Alps' unique characteristics.
Promote sustainable tourism practices and integrated development in the region.
llama_json.research_subject: Development of the Mediterranean Alps as a sustainable tourist destination

motivations: There is a need to structure the governance of the Mediterranean Alps as a tourist destination within the European Park.
The unique features and diversity of this protected site need to be highlighted and valued through a sustainable tourism strategy.
objectives: Create the tourist destination of Mediterranean Alps through structured governance and a sustainable tourism strategy.
Enhance the operational capacities of the European Grouping of Territorial Cooperation uniting Mercantour Park and Maritime Alps Park.
Continue the cooperation experience through the construction of an integrated territorial initiative for multi-sector integrated development.
methods: Structure the governance of the Mediterranean Alps within the European Park.
Define a territorial strategy of sustainable tourism, with a focus on trekking, to highlight the diversity and uniqueness of the site.
Construct an integrated territorial initiative for a better definition of multi-sector integrated development.
results: Establishment of the Mediterranean Alps as a recognized tourist destination.
Enhanced operational capacities of the European Grouping of Territorial Cooperation.
Continued cooperation and integrated development across multiple sectors.
openai_json.research_subject: Creation and development of the Mediterranean Alps as a tourist destination

motivations: The Mediterranean Alps region lacks a unified touristic destination identity and governance structure despite its unique protected sites and natural diversity.
There is a need for sustainable tourism strategies that can effectively valorize the peculiarities of this protected transboundary area.
objectives: Create and establish the Mediterranean Alps as a recognized touristic destination through structured governance within the European Park framework.
Develop a territorial strategy for sustainable tourism that valorizes the diversity and unique characteristics of the protected sites, particularly for trekking activities.
methods: Structure governance through the European Grouping of Territorial Cooperation uniting Mercantour Park and Maritime Alps Park.
Build upon existing cooperation experiences from the World Heritage project to construct an integrated territorial initiative for multi-sector development.
results: Establishment of operational capacities for the European Grouping of Territorial Cooperation to manage the Mediterranean Alps destination.
Creation of an integrated territorial initiative enabling better definition and implementation of multi-sector integrated development.
Enhanced valorization of the protected sites through sustainable tourism practices.
anthropic_json.research_subject: Development of Mediterranean Alps as a sustainable touristic destination through transboundary cooperation
